qas.question: Where were slaves shipped to from West Africa?
What was the name of the African burial ground in New York City?
What does "Begraafplaats van de Neger" mean?

context: In the <a1_0>Colonial America<a1_0/> of 1619, <a0_0>John Rolfe<a0_0/> used negars in describing the slaves who were captured from West Africa and then shipped to the <a2_0>Virginia colony<a2_0/>. Later American English spellings, neger and neggar, prevailed in a northern colony, New York under the Dutch, and in metropolitan Philadelphia's Moravian and Pennsylvania Dutch communities; the African Burial Ground in New York City originally was known by the Dutch name <a3_0>"Begraafplaats van de Neger"<a3_0/> (<a4_0>Cemetery of the Negro<a4_0/>); an early US occurrence of neger in Rhode Island, dates from 1625. Thomas Jefferson also used the term "black" in his Notes on the State of Virginia in allusion to the slave populations.
